creator: michaelchikit@gmail.com
text:
Hi,
  We are using apache 2.0. We found someone exploit apache server. Someone
inject some html under our web root.
  I have checked those is created by apache user and owned apache user.
Moreover, we have any script to allow to upload file to that direcotry.

Regards,
Michael

By far the most likely explanation is that there is a vulnerability in a script
or program that you are using with apache, and not in apache httpd itself.  You
should start by checking all scripts and programs called by httpd to see if
there are known problems.  (A likely culprit is phpBB, which has a
currently-circulating exploit.)

If you still believe that the problem is a flaw in apache httpd, then please
contact our non-public security mailing list: security@apache.org.
creator: slive@apache.org
